intro: Matelea angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf matelea, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open woodlands. Matelea angustifolia is adapted to drought conditions and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
